channel.title: Need help with java jdk
channel.description: Ok when i try to use java apps. it doesnt let me play...for example with pkisle client it doesnt even let me load.It saids 'JAVA' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . . plz help me

item.title: Need help with java jdk
item.dc:creator: @Zenzie Zenzie
item.description:
@Zenzie wrote:

C:Windows\System32;“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin”

must be

C:Windows\System32;“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6_01\bin”

if you use update 1 change it in all the files you use

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with java jdk
item.dc:creator: @cccrrraaazzziii cccrrraaazzziii
item.description:
@cccrrraaazzziii wrote:

Ok before we can fix the compiler and runeserver, we need to set out variables. Ok go into start menu, then control panel, then system, then advanced, then enviromental variables.

start menu -> control panel -> system -> advanced -> enviromental variables

Ok now find the variable called “path” in the list in that new screen open. Rename it to “PATH” and then for it’s variable value (erase old one):
C:Windows\System32;“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin”

You will also need to set a variables called “classpath”. Make a new variable and give it the name classpath. No add this in for it’s value:
“C:\Program Files\Java\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin”

Quote from Mod Tahrok’s Ultimate Server Guide. Try to follow this. Setting the paths is important, it’ so the compiler knows where to locate the java.

Read full topic
